result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario Daryl Woods was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments and costs by the end of supervision period.
All financial obligations to be paid through collection of sums by DOC from 25% of prison funds and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with time now being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school or combination of both totaling 40 hours per week.

No alcohol or illegal drugs.
No driving without valid license.
Obtain AODA assessment. Complete recommended follow up care/treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.  Defendant informed he may not possess and/or own any firearms; also informed he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario Daryl Woods

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received and filed:  Original Transcript of Proceedings PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING commencing 11-23-15 (19 pages) and Certification of Filing Transcript.
Letter response to Defendant's pro se letter request to vacate DNA surcharge
Defendant's pro se letter request to vacate DNA surcharge.

Defendant Mario Daryl Woods in court with Attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Defendant Mario Daryl Woods in custody.  
Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Motion Hearing.  Defense withdraws motion; plea forms submitted to the court.

Attorney Steven R. Kohn in court, defendant Mario Daryl Woods not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Motion Hearing.  The Court adjourned the matter to October 27, 2015 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court for a motion hearing.
Motion to Suppress filed by Atty. Steven Kohn on behalf of the defendant.

Attorney Steven R. Kohn in court, defendant Mario Daryl Woods not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a motion to suppress hearing date.

  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM  635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Case adjourned to 09-24-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 30, Judge Conen's Court for Motion to Suppress Hearing.

Defendant Mario Daryl Woods in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Defendant Mario Daryl Woods in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Sergio Rentas-MPD Officer.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02 due to the charges in this matter.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and not to possess or use any dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (6-26-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Mario Daryl Woods in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 06-25-2015 at 01:30pm
